ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Ability to read and write in Devanagri Script. Ability to communicate comfortably. More about Indian society and culture, literature, etc.
I learned to read devanagari and practiced speaking Hindi.
I learned how to read and write Hindi and also how to speak it more fluently.

Learned how to read and write hindi, advanced vocabulary, and some basic grammar topics. Went from not being able to read a singular letter in the alphabet to reading short passages somewhat easily, and being able to write works of 200+ words.
Reading and Writing skills.
I have learned how to read and write in Hindi.
Better learned how to speak and write hindi
Literacy skills in the Hindi language as well as formalization of grammar rules
how to read and write Hindi well, speaking familiarity, vocab, grammar

I learned how to read and write in Hindi, carry conversations about social issues and more sensitive and serious topics deeper than light conversation in Hindi. I also learned a lot more about fixing my grammar.
I learned how to read and write
I learned a lot of new speaking in Hindi which was one of my biggest weaknesses entering the course.
Improved Hindi vocabulary, grammar, speaking, reading, and writing skills

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very easy to follow, paced well, learned how to read and write effectively.
Good learning experience! A bit confusing on grades.

The course was very well-planned and it was apparent from the start that Mansiji truly cared about her students. Throughout the semester we continuously built upon the ideas we learned and everything we did in class, whether it was having conversations, doing practices, watching music videos, etc. was extremely relevant to what we were learning.

The strengths of this course are the stress-free environment created by the teacher and the ability to make mistakes without too much penalty. Only weakness is the workload varies significantly week to week.

Strength: The content was engaging. The structure ensured we got the maximum practice in. 
Weakness: More emphasis on speaking skills would have been great
This course was great in fostering discussion between peers and teachers and allowed for a collaborative environment filled with growth.
It really facilitates learning in a happy, low-stress environment. I enjoyed coming to class.

The strengths of this course start with Mansiji and the energy of acceptance of making mistakes while learning that she brings into the classroom. I love how easy she makes it available to speak our thoughts in a group discussion and to speak to her about other things as well. I liked having partner switch offs while reading, especially for people like me who were conscious about reading in front of the whole class. A possible weakness could be how quick paced I felt like the grammar was so it made it hard to retain it all, but it makes sense with the classs pace.
I think the course as it is for heritage students should focus on language usage instead of writing
I think the class was fantastic; I personally would want to spend more time learning speaking and comprehension though since Im stronger at reading and writing.
Strengths were many different resources were used for teaching and were engaging

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! If you have prior familiarity with Hindi, and want to learn how to write and improve your speaking skills, absolutely take it.
Yeah, it's fun and educational.

Yes definitely!! It was my favorite course this semester and I learned so much. I felt so well-supported because of the smaller class size. I received direct feedback on all my quizzes and assignments, which helped me improve so much, and I saw the direct impact the class had on my Hindi.
Yes, I definitely would. Would also recommend taking it earlier so you are in a class with students in your year.
Yes, only if you have a decent background in Hindi (i.e. strong understanding of spoken Hindi). The learning curve is steep.
I would definitely recommend this course to other students, as it has allowed for a deeper comprehension of the languages.
Yes, I would
Yes
Yes definitely!!!
Sure if u want an opportunity to get to have hindi exposure
Yes: its super fun, engaging, and Mansi Ji is very nice!
Yes, great course for heritage speakers to learn Hindi and great instructor
